{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3113345,"name":"Zachary","username":"Zatack7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zatack7/{size}/175437_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T16:59:28.357Z","cooked":"

Would a robot designed/built in, say, Denver experience noticeably different performance (with regards to the pneumatic system) while competing at champs in Houston?
This got into my head recently and I gotta know.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T17:51:22.766Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":85,"reads":541,"readers_count":540,"score":578.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"Zachary","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53819,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"ban the rev 40a breaker"},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/1","custom_user_title":"ban the rev 40a breaker","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3113350,"name":null,"username":"anon91718515","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T17:21:40.935Z","cooked":"

Yes, in at least one area. Bumpers made at high altitude compress at sea level to the point where they need to be rebuilt (fabric tightened, at least) to perform as designed. I don’t think anything else has been effected in our trips to low altitudes. Game piece inflation is done on-site to specifications, otherwise that would also be a huge issue.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T17:21:40.935Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":536,"readers_count":535,"score":272.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11148,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113357,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T17:38:41.347Z","cooked":"

2013 may have had different aerodynamic performance with the frisbees.

Pneumatic pressure is relative to the environment, so that should not meaningfully change.

Cooling performance on the compressor could possibly suffer, but that would be rare (and in back-to-back matches where your compressor is on almost the whole match).

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T17:59:18.427Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":523,"readers_count":522,"score":154.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/3","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113367,"name":"Ryan Swanson","username":"Ryan_Swanson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_swanson/{size}/171065_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T18:05:37.804Z","cooked":"

I recall @waialua359 and 359 in 2016 had issues with their pneumatic catapult in Duluth when there was a big temperature drop in the arena during the playoffs. The overhead doors had opened up for teams to load out, and the temp in the venue dropped noticeably.

Totally not what the OP asked, but I thought it was interesting.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T18:05:37.804Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":488,"readers_count":487,"score":122.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"Ryan Swanson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21692,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113370,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T18:14:55.190Z","cooked":"

Mmm this is related

In the end you are looking at changes in air density. Cold air is more dense, low elevation is more dense, low humidity is (slightly) more dense.

In the case of venue temp dropping quickly (without time to re-tune something that is highly force and acceleration dependent, like a pneumatic catapult )
these differences in density could matter, although I suspect they would be negligible compared to the projectile flying through denser air.

Pneumatic systems are relatively isolated from these effects because the working pressure side of the system is theoretically constant.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T18:15:45.377Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":464,"readers_count":463,"score":122.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":21692,"username":"Ryan_Swanson","name":"Ryan Swanson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_swanson/{size}/171065_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/5","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113398,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T19:49:16.311Z","cooked":"

Atmospheric pressure at sea level is 14.7 psi, and it’s 12 psi in Denver.

So, if you completely pressurized your system in Denver (60psi relative working gage pressure, or 72psi absolute), and then brought the robot down to sea level and had no leaks or anything, the gauge would now read 57.3 psi, which is about 4% drop.

Since your regulator works on gage pressure and not absolute pressure, the second you open your valve upstream, the reg would repressurize it back to 60psi.

If you closed it up again and brought your robot to outer space, the gage would then read 74.7psi. Also any pneumatic launchers would be pretty effective thanks to weightlessness.

If they announced a water game (finally) and you brought your robot to the ocean and dropped it down to a depth of 140 feet, it would read a pressure of 0. So that’s how you lose all your pneumatic performance. Via water game.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T19:49:16.311Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":407,"readers_count":406,"score":101.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113401,"name":"Mark Wasserman","username":"Mark_Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T19:58:06.955Z","cooked":"

Our robot moves so fast that air resistance effects the PID control loop settings and they need to be adjusted based on altitude. Lucky for us we live in a flat area so that part of the lookup table is never exercised.

On a serious note, humidity has effected us in the past. (2012 basketball).

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T19:58:06.955Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":358,"readers_count":357,"score":121.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"Mark Wasserman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30473,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly"},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/7","custom_user_title":"Not fast swerve, but good swerve driven quickly","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113406,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T20:07:55.090Z","cooked":"

I suppose Jerry has a lookup table for relativistic effects.

Humidity and game pieces in the sense that ball grippiness was different? If I recall those foam balls for 2012 were pretty dense.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T20:07:55.090Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":74.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30473,"username":"Mark_Wasserman","name":"Mark Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/8","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113408,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T20:12:03.743Z","cooked":"

How about tangential affects? Our team is from below sea level and back in 2014 we went to Denver for a regional. While we didn’t notice any real differences in robot performance. We did however notice a difference in human performance. Just walking up stairs or running from pit to pit left everyone gasping for air. We got used to it after the first day but it was an interesting experience.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T20:13:30.235Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":331,"readers_count":330,"score":121.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/9","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113413,"name":null,"username":"anon91718515","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T20:28:08.998Z","cooked":"

Yeah, if traveling to Denver or Salt Lake (and maybe Idaho? IDK) make sure your team knows about this.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T20:28:08.998Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":307,"readers_count":306,"score":66.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33848,"username":"jedgar6","name":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11148,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113414,"name":"GaryVoshol","username":"GaryVoshol","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/garyvoshol/{size}/1658_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T20:36:46.531Z","cooked":"

One year after CMP in Atlanta we went home via Smokey Mountain National Park. At Klingman’s Dome we and many others were panting on our way up the slight slope to the summit.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-12-23T20:36:46.531Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":309,"readers_count":308,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":420129,"topic_slug":"do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all","display_username":"GaryVoshol","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"FLL and FRC Volunteer","title_is_group":false,"reply_to_user":{"id":11148,"username":"anon91718515","name":null,"avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":5172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/do-altitude-changes-affect-robot-performance-at-all/420129/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3113418,"name":"Scott W","username":"Programming4907","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/programming4907/{size}/168313_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-23T20:49:30.627Z","cooked":"

While we didn’t use any pneumatics this year, if you happen to be building a vacuum syringe jumping robot, then yes, air pressure makes a big difference. In the case of building it in Denver and competing in Houston, the air pressure difference is in your favour and it’ll jump 22% higher for the same piston displacement distance. However, you need to gear your winching motors such that they can provide 22% more torque when you’re preparing to climb at champs.

This was actually a fun question the students figured out during our build season.

The geographic location here in Southwestern Ontario ranges between about 200 and 250m above sea level, so it’s not a huge difference in air pressure between here and Houston. But we knew that if champs were in Denver (1609m) we wouldn’t be able to reach the traversal bar.

In fact, barometric pressure changes quite a bit just due to weather variations. Even over the next 10 days locally, we’re expecting almost a 4% change in barometric pressure from the highest to the lowest pressure. We always hoped for it to be sunny on competition days because it jumped a little higher.

That is a really cool anecdote, thank you for sharing! Did you guys have a way of changing the height of the “plunger” so that you could lower the jump height?

And don’t forgot about bagged snacks. If you brought them to denver from your home below sea level, they could pop/explode open. It may catch someone by surprise… worst case scenario, your snack is stale when you want to eat it later.

Regular pneumatics use gauge pressures, so they don’t depend on the ambient air pressure.

4907 with their jumping robot that’s powered by vacuum (i.e. negative pressure) may well be affected on the other hand. Assuming the robot pulls a near full vacuum, the pressure differential on the piston will be equal to the ambient air pressure. If the robot were calibrated to jump in Death Valley with 1.02 atm ambient pressure and then tested in Denver with 0.83 atm ambient, you’d expect it not to jump as high. Same goes for the 2019 robots that used vacuum to hold on the to HAB platforms; they wouldn’t work as well at higher elevations.

Semi-related but because of variations in gravity across Earth’s surface, we have discovered our robot can become lighter or heavier on different continents. The maximum range is 0.7% and we have observed about half a pound change. Not fun when you’re 124.9 lbs at home.

Yes, the piston winch distance was software controlled with a constant that they could change if necessary. I think by the end of the season it was just set at the max winch distance because it gave them a little extra insurance in case something went wrong, like grazing an alliance member’s bumpers on the way up, which happened a couple times.

There was originally talk of having two jump heights, one for the traversal bar and one for the high bar, just in case strategy required it, but we never installed the high bar on our test hangar to try it out, and the need to climb to the high bar never arose during competition (that I’m aware of).
